availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Andrew J. Rice and Phoeba Rice. Resident in Johnson County in 1850. Resident in Johnson County in 1860. Private in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 124B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 18.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, Precinct 1, p. 14.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, County Marriages, Film #001003628, p. 734.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894.
Find A Grave, "John Rice (1845-1908)," Memorial #82255107, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82255107# (accessed November 12, 2018).
